<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Discriminated union of Pass ID types.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The PassConfig API prefers dealing with IDs because they are safer and more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// efficient. IDs decouple configuration from instantiation. This way, when a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// pass is overriden, it isn&#39;t unnecessarily instantiated. It is also unsafe to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// refer to a Pass pointer after adding it to a pass manager, which deletes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// redundant pass instances.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// However, it is convient to directly instantiate target passes with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// non-default ctors. These often don&#39;t have a registered PassInfo. Rather than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// force all target passes to implement the pass registry boilerplate, allow</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the PassConfig API to handle either type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// AnalysisID is sadly char&#42;, so PointerIntPair won&#39;t work.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/identifyingpassptr"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/identifyingpassptr/#a790955cd308751a47af3047ad6a048f3">IdentifyingPassPtr</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a portion of the normal code-gen pass sequence.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If the StartAfter and StartBefore pass ID is zero, then compilation will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// begin at the normal point; otherwise, clear the Started flag to indicate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// that passes should not be added until the starting pass is seen.  If the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Stop pass ID is zero, then compilation will continue to the end.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This function expects that at least one of the StartAfter or the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// StartBefore pass IDs is null.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> setStartStopPasses();</span></CodeLine>
